Precious light has been permitted to shine upon our pathway, and around us are the angels of heaven, who are interested in our welfare. . . . The love of Christ manifested toward us in His life of humiliation and self-denial, in His death on Calvary, should call forth songs of gratitude from our lips. The hope of His soon coming should fill us with sacred joy (Signs of the Times, Dec. 8, 1890).
